content:
Yes, here are some popular bars in the French Quarter for drinks after dinner:

1. The Carousel Bar & Lounge at Hotel Monteleone - a classic revolving bar with an extensive cocktail menu. 2. Lafitte's Blacksmith Shop Bar - a historic bar rumored to be the oldest in the country, with an outdoor courtyard and candlelit interiors. 3. Pat O'Brien's - famous for its hurricane cocktail and outdoor patio. 4. The Sazerac Bar at The Roosevelt Hotel - a classic cocktail bar with a chic, Art Deco-inspired interior. 5. Napoleon House - a charming bar with an old-world charm, complete with a lovely courtyard and large selection of beers on tap. 6. The Old Absinthe House - a historic bar with a reputation for serving absinthe, along with other cocktails and beer. 7. The Spotted Cat Music Club - a lively spot known for its live jazz music and fun atmosphere. All of these bars have their unique ambiance and drinks that are sure to provide a fun and memorable experience.
